footer_text_1: The portal is provided by the Policy Compass project, which has received funding from the European Union's Seventh Framework Programme for research, technological development and demonstration.
footer_text_3: All work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License, unless it says otherwise.
intro_cedus_text: The Cedus Data Interpreter Tool simplifies the way you utilize, interact, mash-up, visualise and interpret the increasing amount of Open Data from reliable sources.
intro_cedus_text_2: Browse content produced by fellow Cedus members
Data_Discovery_Text: If the Open Data source that you would like to use with Cedus has not already been uploaded, use this function to jump immediately into uploading Data Tables.
Visualising_Datasets_Text: Cedus platform grants users and decision makers the ability to visualise datasets by using different graphical forms, such as line graphs, pie, bar or map charts.
Visualising_Datasets_Text_2: By giving users the freedom to mashup different Datasets, Cedus grants us the power to describe real world situations from data.
Annotate_Text: Register Historical Events which can later be used to annotate visualisation graphs.
cookie_law_alert: We use cookies to ensure that we give you the best experience on our website.
cookie_law_alert_2: By using our website you agree to our use of cookies in accordance with our cookie policy.
help_step1_create_dataset: Provide your source data, either by typing or copying it into the data grid or by uploading a file (CSV, XLS, XLSX). You can easily pre-edit your data here. A right click into the sheet offers you more options.
help_step1_warning_message_header: Please make sure that your dataset complies with the following  rules:
help_step1_warning_message_rule2: It has 1 time dimension and 1 or more label dimensions with numeric values
help_step1_warning_message_rule3: There are no missing dates in between the time dimension and no repeated dates
help_step1_warning_message_rule4: The minimum time resolution is the day
help_step2_create_dataset: Your data refers to a specific dimension type, e.g. countries. Please select your dimension type. The instances for a dimension type, e.g. France for type Country are called dimensions. Pick the corresponding cells in the source data which represent your dimensions. Furthermore you can add specific metadata in order to describe your dataset in more detail. For example: Create a dataset for several countries, but just refering to women. If you want to refer to men as well you need to create another dataset.
title_step3_create_dataset: Step 3 - Define Time Resolution, Start and End Date
help_step3_create_dataset: Your dataset will provide data over a specific time range. Please select the time resolution and pick the start and end date from your source data.
help_step3_warning_message_header: Please ensure that there are no gaps between dates.
help_step4_create_dataset: Now please provide the actual data for each dimesion and time period by selecting it in the source data and adding it to the target table. If your data is already in the same format like the target table you can select the 'Table Mode' to copy everything in one step.
help_step5_create_dataset: Please provide the unit your values are in.
help_step6_create_dataset: Congratulations, you can now see the resulting. If you require any changes, go back to any of the previous steps and make amendments/changes as required. You can also edit the values of the dataset right here.
help_step7_create_dataset: Please provide additional metadata to describe the dataset further. This allows users to easily understand what the data is and the full provenance and context of the data.
Please provide a Data Dimension Type.
Please choose one option for each Dimens: Please choose one option for each Dimension.
Please choose at least one Data Dimensio: Please choose at least one Data Dimension.

Duration_Info: Subscriptions have a duration. Once that duration is expired, the subscription is simply ignored.
Create a suscription to the context brok: Create a suscription to the context broker
Throttling_Info: The throttling element is used to specify a minimum inter-notification arrival time. So, setting throttling to 5 seconds, makes a notification not to be sent if a previous notification was sent less than 5 seconds ago, no matter how many actual changes take place in that period. This is to give the notification receptor a means to protect itself against context producers that update attribute values too frequently.
